title: Processes - Area between Curves - Functions of y

content.question: Let <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded above by the graph of <math alttext=" y equals, the fraction 4 over pi, end fraction, times the arccosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction x over 4, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>arccos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and below by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 2 minus the square root of x" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>, as shown in the figure above. What is the area of the region?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 16 over pi, end fraction, plus eight thirds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 16 over pi, minus eight thirds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 16 over pi, minus eight thirds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.5: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of y

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
